inlineContent.text: Customize the appearance and handle capture and scanning sessions.
Set a custom image or modify the shutter button color.
Set a custom image for the shutter button.
Make the tint green.
Modify the scanning activity indicator.
The scanning activity indicator can be configured through
Set a custom text, font, and color to be displayed while an image is scanned.
Set the text displayed when scanning completes.
When a product is detected, a result indicator is displayed on top of it.
Result indicators can be configured through
Set custom colors and fonts.
Customize icons for the indicators.
Modify the pulse animation.
Customize the appearance when an indicator is selected.
When a result indicator is tapped, a banner is displayed with the product details.
The result banner can be customized through
A bottom bar with the
and
is displayed after scanning.
The bar can be customized through
Tapping on the result bar displays a list of all detected products, their promotions, and the details of the current store.
The list view can be customized through
The cards can be customized through
Tapping on a result banner or on a card in the result list displays a detailed view of the product.
The details view can be configured through
SinglePhotoVC can be subclassed for easier modification.
Create a new class named
and import BlinkShelf to set SinglePhotoVC as the parent class.
Add a viewfinder icon at the center of the screen.
Set a capture region for your camera. In this example, it is set to 80% of the screen. When
is not set, the entire screen is captured by default.
The captured image will be displayed full-screen in the result view.
Draw a border around the capture region and insert it behind the shutter button.
Manually manage the camera session or add a custom implementation while an image is scanned.
Start or stop the camera session manually.
Listen to
to add a custom implementation when the camera session starts or stops.
Set
to false to disable automatically scanning the captured image and listen to
to add a custom implementation instead.
When youâ€™re ready to scan, you may use
